revised_title: Observations of Two Northern Auroras in 1716 and 1717
tldr: The Reverend Edmund Barrell describes his observations of two Northern Aurora events in 1716 and 1717 from the Vicarage of Sutton at Hone in Kent. He provides detailed accounts of the appearance, location, and behavior of the auroras, including the shooting of bright rays and the presence of a long streak of light extending across the sky.
